greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: n/p^k, where p = largest prime dividing n and p^k = highest power of p dividing n.
link: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=1..10000
example: a(36) = 4 because 36/3^2 = 4, 3^2 is highest power dividing 36 of largest prime dividing 36.
program: def a(n): return n/a053585(n) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 19 2017
results.author: _Leroy Quet_
ext: More terms from _James A. Sellers_, Jan 21 2000
